articles.author: Artorn Pookasook, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: Israel expanded its targets in its war with Hezbollah militants in Lebanon on Monday, killing at least 21 people in an airstrike in the north, health officials said, while millions of Israelis took shelter from projectiles fired back across the border.
articles.title: Israel strikes north Lebanon town, UN expresses concern about peacekeepers

articles.author: Jason Lange
articles.description: Democratic Vice President Kamala Harris held a marginal 3-percentage-point lead over Republican Donald Trump - 45% to 42% - as the two stayed locked in a tight race to win the Nov. 5 U.S. presidential election, a new Reuters/Ipsos poll found.
articles.title: Exclusive: Harris holds steady, marginal 45%-42% lead over Trump, Reuters/Ipsos poll finds

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korean state media on Wednesday said around 1.4 million young people including students and youth league officials joined or returned to the army this week.
articles.title: North Korea claims 1.4 million young people joined the army this week

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The World Bank, under pressure to do more to help developing countries cope with climate change, voted on Tuesday to change its internal lending guidelines to free up $30 billion in additional lending capacity over the next decade, World Bank President Ajay Banga told Reuters.
articles.title: EXCLUSIVE World Bank acts to boost lending capacity by $30 bln over 10 years

articles.author: Krishn Kaushik, David Ljunggren
articles.description: The prime ministers of India and Canada could benefit politically in the short term from the unprecedented expulsion of top diplomats from each country, analysts said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Deepening Canada-India standoff seen as a short-term boost for Modi, Trudeau

articles.author: Suleiman Al-Khalidi, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: Israel may expand its ground operations against Hezbollah while bolstering its own defences.
articles.title: Israel's demining near Golan signals wider front against Hezbollah, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pakistan has agreed to increase security for Chinese citizens and projects in the South Asian nation, a joint statement said on Tuesday, as Beijing called for urgent security measures following an escalation in militant threats in the country.
articles.title: Pakistan to increase security for Chinese projects as Beijing calls for urgent steps

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces tightened their squeeze around Jabalia in the north of the enclave, amid fierce battles with Hamas-led fighters.
articles.title: Israel kills at least 40 in Gaza, tanks deepen raid in the north

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hundreds of people attended prayers on Tuesday for 19 villagers who died when flash floods and landslides swept through swathes of central and southern Bosnia 10 days ago, killing at least 26 people and destroying whole villages and roads.
articles.title: Bosnians bury 19 victims of devastating floods

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian drones launched a series of attacks on Tuesday on Russia's southern border region of Belgorod, injuring at least eight people and damaging cars and property, Regional Governor Vyacheslav Gladkov said.
articles.title: Eight injured in series of drone attacks in Russia's Belgorod region
